001package io.github.ai4ci.abm;
002
003import java.util.List;
004import java.util.Optional;
005import java.util.stream.Collectors;
006import java.util.stream.IntStream;
007
008import org.immutables.value.Value;
009
010/**
011 * The historical state of the whole model. This is typically used to collect
012 * summary statistics for output from the {@link OutbreakState}, but also can
013 * play a role in informing the {@link io.github.ai4ci.abm.policy.PolicyModel}
014 *
015 * OutbreakHistory items are generated from OutbreakState items using the
016 * {@link HistoryMapper} during the update cycle.
017 */
018@Value.Immutable
019public interface OutbreakHistory extends OutbreakTemporalState {
020
021        /**
022         *
023         * The current state of knowledge about people with test negative results
024         * from this day (which is potentially in the past) as assessed at current
025         * simulation time. <br>
026         * An observed value:
027         *
028         * @return the number of people with all negative test results reported for
029         *         tests taken on this day, as observed at the current simulation
030         *         time.
031         */
032        default int getCurrentTestNegativesBySampleDate() {
033                return this.getTestNegativesBySampleDate(
034                                this.getEntity().getCurrentState().getTime()
035                );
036        }
037
038        /**
039         * An observed value:<br>
040         * <br>
041         * The current state of knowledge about test positive results from samples
042         * taken on this day (potentially in the past). This is output as part of the
043         * delay distribution of tests, as it gives a positive test count for a given
044         * day that increases in the future. (N.B. This looks over complicated and I
045         * question its utility, it is also misleading as it is a count of people
046         * with any positive test)
047         *
048         * @return the number of people with any positive test result reported for
049         *         tests taken on this day, as observed at the current simulation
050         *         time.
051         */
052        default int getCurrentTestPositivesBySampleDate() {
053                return this.getTestPositivesBySampleDate(
054                                this.getEntity().getCurrentState().getTime()
055                );
056        }
057
058        /**
059         * Internal helper function for looking at delay of test results
060         *
061         * @return the maximum delay of test results for any person in the model, as
062         *         observed in the history. This is used to determine how far forward
063         *         to look when calculating test positive/negative counts by sample
064         *         date.
065         */
066        @Value.Lazy
067        default int getMaxDelay() {
068                return ModelNav.peopleHistory(this).mapToInt(ph -> ph.getMaxDelay()).max()
069                                .orElse(0);
070        }
071
072        /**
073         * The previous entry in the history of this outbreak.
074         *
075         * @return An optional containing the previous history entry, or empty if
076         *         this is the first entry (time=0).
077         */
078        default Optional<OutbreakHistory> getPrevious() {
079                return this.getEntity().getHistoryEntry(this.getTime() - 1);
080        }
081
082        /**
083         *
084         * The number of people with all tests reported as negative on the given day
085         * <br>
086         * An observed value:
087         *
088         * @see #getTestPositivesBySampleDate() for the logic here.
089         *
090         * @return a list of counts of people with all negative test results reported
091         *         retrospective to today.
092         */
093        @Value.Lazy
094        default List<Integer> getTestNegativesBySampleDate() {
095                return IntStream.range(0, this.getMaxDelay()).mapToObj(delay -> {
096                        return ModelNav.peopleHistory(this).mapToInt(p -> {
097                                if (p.getTodaysTests().isEmpty()) { return 0; }
098                                // If any of a persons results are positive today
099                                return p.getResultsBySampleDate(this.getTime() + delay)
100                                                .allMatch(t -> !t.getFinalObservedResult()) ? 1 : 0;
101                        }).sum();
102                }).collect(Collectors.toList());
103        }
104
105        /**
106         * The total test negatives reported from this day, as reported on another
107         * day (typically in the future). This handles delay distribution of test
108         * results and will tell us what is known about tests taken today on day x.
109         * All tests taken on this day must be negative for the person to count as a
110         * test negative.
111         *
112         * An observed value:<br>
113         *
114         * @param time the simulation time at which to assess the test negative
115         *             counts for
116         * @return the number of people with all negative test results reported for
117         *         tests
118         *
119         */
120        default int getTestNegativesBySampleDate(int time) {
121                var lim = time - this.getTime();
122                if (lim < 0) { return 0; }
123                return this.getTestNegativesBySampleDate().stream().limit(lim)
124                                .reduce(Integer::sum).orElse(0);
125        }
126
127        /**
128         * An observed value:<br>
129         * <br>
130         * The number of people with tests reported as positive on the day of
131         * testing. looking forward through time until the result is available. The
132         * result is a forward distribution of positive test counts indexed by delay.
133         * So first is the tests with positive results available today, second is
134         * those with results tomorrow etc.
135         *
136         * @return a list of counts of people with any positive test result reported
137         *         retrospective to today.
138         */
139        @Value.Lazy
140        default List<Integer> getTestPositivesBySampleDate() {
141                return IntStream.range(0, this.getMaxDelay()).mapToObj(delay -> {
142                        return ModelNav.peopleHistory(this).mapToInt(p ->
143                        // If any of a persons results are positive today
144                        p.getResultsBySampleDate(this.getTime() + delay)
145                                        .anyMatch(t -> t.getFinalObservedResult()) ? 1 : 0
146                        ).sum();
147                }).collect(Collectors.toList());
148        }
149
150        /**
151         * An observed value:<br>
152         * <br>
153         * The total test positive people reported from this day, as reported on
154         * another day (typically in the future). This handles delay distribution of
155         * test results and will tell us what is known about tests taken today on day
156         * X. Any positive value is counted as a test positive person on this day.
157         *
158         * @param time the simulation time at which to assess the test positive
159         *             counts for
160         * @return the number of people with any positive test result reported for
161         *         tests taken on this day, as observed at the given time.
162         */
163        default int getTestPositivesBySampleDate(int time) {
164                var lim = time - this.getTime();
165                if (lim < 0) { return 0; }
166                return this.getTestPositivesBySampleDate().stream().limit(lim)
167                                .reduce(Integer::sum).orElse(0);
168        }
169
170}
